longTitle.p: An Act to provide for the control by the Director-General of Police of the Administration of the Madras City Police.
Whereas it is expedient to place the Commissioner of Police, Madras, under the control and direction of the Director-General of Police.
It is hereby enacted as follows:

content.p: This Act may be called the Madras City Police (Amendment) Act, 1907, and it shall come into force on such date as the State Government may, by a notification in the Official Gazette direct.

section.heading: Control of the Director-General over the Commissioner of Police

content.p: Notwithstanding anything contained in the Madras City Police Act, 1888 (Mad. Act III of 1888), the Commissioner of Police for the City of Madras shall, in the exercise of his functions under the said Act except those under section 7 thereof be under the control and direction of the Director-General of Police for the Presidency of Madras, subject to any rules that may be made under section 3.

section.heading: Power of State Government to make rules

content.p: It shall be competent to the State Government to make rules to limit and regulate the exercise of the powers of control and direction conferred on the Director-General of Police by section 2 in respect of the Commissioner of Police for the City of Madras.
